heading: Thursday Night
text: Partly cloudy early, then clouds redeveloping from west to east. Areas of fog or freezing fog, mainly east of the Greens. Lows from the mid 20s to lower 30s west of the Greens, and upper teens to mid 20s east. Winds becoming south to southeast 5 to 10 mph.

heading: Friday
text: Mostly cloudy. Chance of freezing drizzle early, mainly over high terrain, and chance of early freezing rain in the St. Lawrence Valley. Otherwise a rising chance of morning rain showers far north, and in New York, with a rising chance elsewhere in the afternoon, reaching southern New Hampshire late. Highs from the upper 30s to mid 40s. Winds becoming south 5 to 15 mph east of the Greens, gusting to 25 mph in the west, except to 40 mph in the Champlain Valley, and possibly gusting to 50 mph in the Advisory Area.

heading: Friday Night
text: Mostly cloudy. Rain likely early, tapering off from west to east after midnight. Patchy freezing rain possible northeast. Areas of fog. Lows in the low to mid 30s, except mid to upper 30s southeast. South winds 10 to 20 mph, gusting to 40 mph early in the Champlain Valley, and possibly gusting to 50 mph in the Advisory Area, all becoming west 5 to 15 mph after midnight.
